result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony P Panella in court, in custody, with attorney Gary R. Schmaus.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CF752 and 14CF825, Court grants the State's motion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Anthony P Panella in court, in custody, with attorney Gary R. Schmaus.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states this will not proceed to plea and requests another date for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plea hearing on December 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anthony P Panella in court, in custody, with attorney Gary R. Schmaus.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a date in 30 days. Court grants request. Bail stands as fixed.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anthony P Panella in court, in custody, with attorney Gary R. Schmaus.   Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense just received discovery and missing some items and requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.
From defendant requesting a bail reduction hearing.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Anthony P Panella in court, in custody, with attorney Gary R. Schmaus.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 31, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with  the co-actor or Nicholas R. listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Anthony P Panella in court, in custody, with attorney Beth Weathers for  Katie Beth Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested within 20 days.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 10:00 am.
